text.titlePage:
A super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations and Hamiltonian
structures, conservation laws
Guoliang He, Yunyun Zhai, and Xianguo Geng
Citation: Journal of Mathematical Physics 54, 083509 (2013); doi: 10.1063/1.4819469
View online: http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.4819469
View Table of Contents: http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/jmp/54/8?ver=pdfcov
Published by the AIP Publishing

Hamiltonian structures and conservation laws of the Belov-Chaltikian lattice hierarchy

AKNS hierarchy, Darboux transformation and conservation laws of the 1D nonautonomous nonlinear
Schrödinger equations

Commuting flows and conservation laws for noncommutative Lax hierarchies
J. Math. Phys. 46, 052701 (2005); 10.1063/1.1865321
A hierarchy of nonlinear evolution equations, its bi-Hamiltonian structure, and finite-dimensional integrable
systems

text.front:
JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS 54, 083509 (2013)
A super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schr ödinger
equations and Hamiltonian structures, conservation laws
Guoliang He,
1 Yunyun Zhai,
2,a) and Xianguo Geng
2
1 Department of Mathematics and Information Science, Zhengzhou University of Light
Industry, Zhengzhou 450002, China
2 School of Mathematics and Statistics, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, 450001, China
(Received 12 April 2013; accepted 14 August 2013; published online 30 August 2013)
A super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations associated with the
3 × 3 matrix spectral problem is proposed by using the Lenard recursion equations
and the zero-curvature equation. The corresponding super bi-Hamiltonian structures
are established with the help of the super trace identity. Furthermore, we derive the
infinite conservation flows of the super vector nonlinear Schrödinger equation and the
second equation in the hierarchy by utilizing spectral parameter expansions. C
2013
AIP Publishing LLC. [http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.4819469]
text.body:
I. INTRODUCTION
The theory of soliton and integrable systems has achieved a great success in the past few
years. The soliton-type properties have been found by now in a variety of nonlinear physical
systems, while the mathematical counterpart of the development has acquired a number of nontrivial
results.
1, 2 Meanwhile, theoretical physics has raised a new fruitful conception of super model
theories, where the fermion fields are added and equally treated with the boson fields. Many classical
integrable equations have been extended to the super ones by adding fermion fields, such as the
super Korteweg-deVries (KdV),
3–6 the super Ablowitz Kaup Newell Segur (AKNS),
7–10 the super
Kadomtsev Petviashvili (KP),
11 and so on.
12–20 If the extended evolution equations are invariant
under the supersymmetric transformation, they are called the supersymmetric evolution equations,
such as the supersymmetric nonlinear Schrödinger equation.
21–24 Otherwise, they are just called the
super ones like that will be considered in this paper. Our understanding of bi-Hamiltonian structures
in the last years before have been greatly enhanced. The bi-Hamiltonian structure is frequently
viewed as one of the key features of integrability and has recently adopted as the basis of the
classification programme.
25–27
There are many methods to extend the normal integrable systems to the super ones, such as
adding the fermion fields to the Lax operator,
23, 24 using the super Lie algebra,
16, 28 and so on. In
this paper, we propose a super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations by using the
Lenard recursion equations and the zero-curvature equation and establish its super bi-Hamiltonian
structures. The fist nontrivial equation in the hierarchy is
u t = −u xx + 2u
2
v + 2uαβ,
v t = v xx − 2uv
2
− 2vαβ,
α t = −α xx + 2uvα,
β t = β xx − 2uvβ,
(1)
text.front: a) Author to whom correspondence should be addressed. Electronic mail: zhai1226@163.com
text.note:
This article is copyrighted as indicated in the article. Reuse of AIP content is subject to the terms at: http://scitation.aip.org/termsconditions. Downloaded to IP:
137.138.124.224 On: Mon, 13 Apr 2015 18:32:22

He, Zhai, and Geng
J. Math. Phys. 54, 083509 (2013)
text.body:
which is just the coupled nonlinear Schrödinger equation, also called Manakov equation, as α = 0,
β = 0,
29 and the second one in it is
u t = −u xxx + 6uvu x + 3u x αβ + 3uα x β,
v t = −v xxx + 6uvv x + 3v x αβ + 3vαβ x ,
α t = −α xxx + 3u x vα + 3uvα x ,
β t = −β xxx + 3uv x β + 3uvβ x .
(2)
Infinite conservation laws of (1) and (2) are derived as a direct consequence of the spectral parameter
expansions.
The layout of the paper is as follows. In Sec. II, we introduce a 3 × 3 matrix spectral problem
with four potentials, where two potentials are boson fields and the other two are fermion fields.
We derive a super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations by utilizing the Lenard
recursion equations and the zero-curvature equation. The super bi-Hamiltonian structures of the
super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations are established with the help of the
super trace identity. Especially, the two super skew-symmetric operators which are proved to satisfy
the super Jacobi identity and the Hamiltonian functions are explicitly given in Sec. III . In Sec. IV,
by considering the spectral problem, we introduce two variables and expand them into series of
spectral parameter. Then, in view of the coefficients of the expandations, we construct the infinite
conservation laws of the first two nontrivial equations in the hierarchy with the aid of the spectral
parameter expansions.
II. A SUPER HIERARCHY OF THE VECTOR NONLINEAR SCHR
DINGER EQUATIONS
In this section, we shall derive a super hierarchy of the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations
associated with a 3 × 3 super matrix spectral problem

G j = c 0 g j + c 1 g j−1 + · · · + c j g 0 , j ≥ 0,

u t 2 = c 0 (−u xx + 2u

(13)
If we choose c 0 = 1, c 1 = c 2 = 0, t 2 = t, Eq. (13) can be reduced to Eq. (1). The second nontrivial
one in (12), when c 0 = 1, c 1 = c 2 = c 3 = 0, t 3 = t, is just Eq. (2).
III. BI-HAMILTONIAN STRUCTURE
In this section, we shall establish the super bi-Hamiltonian structure of the super hierarchy of
the vector nonlinear Schrödinger equations hierarchy by super trace identity

IV. INFINITE CONSERVATION LAWS
In what follows, we shall derive infinite conservation laws of Eqs. (13) and (2). From the spectral
problem (3), we can define two variables R, ρ (p(R) = 0, p(ρ) = 1) as
R =

APPENDIX: PROOF OF THE JACOBI IDENTITY
If we set u 1 = u, u 2 = v, u 3 = α, u 4 = β, and F , G , H three arbitrary bosonic functions, we
can define the Poisson bracket, for the super matrix B, as follows:

H 3 F 4 G 34 = 0 for H 3 , F 4 are fermionic functions. Thus we proved that the operator J satisfies the
super Jacobi identity (A2).

Jacobi identity with the help of integrating terms by parts one or two times.
